page.title: 08MILLS IN SADDLEWORTH
page.content: In this area there were several mills of importance but now they exist only as buildings serving other purposes. The most impressive was Dobcross Loom Works, which was the original site of Wrigley Mill. Finished in 1861, it was famous for woollen and cotton looms which were exported worldwide & were renowned for their lasting qualities. These Hutchinson & Hollingworth looms are now superseded by Italian looms, & the Mill was closed in 1967, to be taken over by Shaws, pallet makers. This is currently a thriving concern. The office building with a Victorian frontage & fine clock are notable. Wharf Mill nearby, built in 1780, was originally the Cooperative Wholesale Society's, but is now a group of small units (upholsterers & sheet metal).At Kiln Green was Henry Smith's, adhesive manufacturer, now an incubator makers.
